image.altText: Garma 2024-50

props.synopsis: The federal government will not create a national commission to lead "truth-telling" about First Nations history, departing from its pre-election promise to do so.

title.children: PM discards commitment to set up Makarrata body despite millions in funding

image.altText: Carlos Alcaraz jumps in the air as he and Novak Djokovic face off before their Paris Olympics gold medal match at Roland Garros.

props.synopsis: Novak Djokovic and Carlos Alcaraz face off for Olympic tennis gold, after Caitlin Parker secures Australia's first medal in women's boxing. Follow live.

title.children: Carlos Alcaraz stands between Novak Djokovic and his first Olympic gold medal

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Tennis: Djokovic takes on Alcaraz in men's final
Boxing: Australian wins, guaranteed a medal
Athletics: Utterly bizarre behaviour in the men's 110m hurdles

image.altText: Anna Dultseva and her daughter walk alongside Vladimir Putin, holding bouquets.

props.synopsis: A family of Russian sleeper agents flown to Moscow in the biggest East-West prisoner swap since the Cold War were so deep undercover that the children found out they were Russians only after the flight took off, according to the Kremlin.

title.children: Children of Russian sleeper agents believed they were Argentinian until flight home

props.synopsis: Eight prisoners, whose crimes included murder, espionage, hacking and fraud, have returned to Russia in the largest prisoner swap between the West and Russia since the Cold War.

title.children: With a hug from Putin, a stark prediction came true as horrified victims watched on

image.altText: A black submarine pokes out of the water.

props.synopsis: The Ukraine military says it also attacked a southern Russian airfield and hit oil depots and fuel and lubricant storage facilities in the Belgorod, Kursk and Rostov regions.

title.children: Ukraine says it has sunk Russian submarine off Sevastopol coast

image.altText: A man sits at a kitchen table with an open laptop in front of him.

props.synopsis: NT home owners say lax residential building regulations have left them dealing with major structural defects they aren't able to get fixed or claim compensation for. They are calling on both sides of NT politics to commit to changing that.

title.children: Jonathan bought a defective new apartment and then found regulators can't do anything about it

image.altText: An exterior photo of Parliament House in Darwin. There are large palm trees out the front.

props.synopsis: As the NT election campaign kicks off, its first week has been marked by big spending promises and criticism of poor consultation over future policy.

title.children: Starter's gun fired on NT election campaign, with big money and policy change promises

image.altText: A woman with dark hair smiling and a man with blond hair and pursed lips

props.synopsis: Kamala Harris's campaign team says Donald Trump is trying to back out of a debate scheduled to run on a rival network.

title.children: Harris, Trump disagree on presidential debate as Trump proposes Fox News event

image.altText: Adelaide researcher Dr Michael Taylor has found legionella bacteria can live on their own

props.synopsis: Victoria's health authorities confirm two people have died in a legionnaires' disease outbreak in Melbourne and dozens of people are in hospital. A source is yet to be identified.

title.children: Two people confirmed dead in Melbourne's legionnaires' disease outbreak with source still unidentified

image.altText: Two men fight among a crowd of protesters in a town square

props.synopsis: False information spread on social media after a knife attack at a children's dance class sparks violent protests across the UK.

title.children: Police hurt in protests across England sparked by misinformation in wake of stabbing attack

image.altText: Anthony Albanese gestures while speaking.

props.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese has appeared on the Insiders program during the second full day of the Garma Festival to discuss his shift on Indigenous affairs. Look back at how the day unfolded.

title.children: PM grilled on Indigenous issues at Garma as leaders look to the future

image.altText: Pool (1)

props.synopsis: In 2020, three childcare workers took six children on their weekly excursion to the pool – but only five made it home. A five-day inquest has probed how one toddler was left behind at a public swimming pool.

title.children: Alone and locked in a public pool, Kumanjayi drowned in minutes. His family wants answers

image.altText: A wide shot overlooking a river bend showing a crocodile in the water and a sand bank opposite

props.synopsis: A large saltwater crocodile was seen in the area where a tourist from New South Wales fell into water while fishing from a river bank in Far North Queensland.

title.children: Search for NSW fisherman after suspected crocodile attack near Cooktown

image.altText: A group of three Olympic medals - with silver, gold and bronze left to right - are shown against a dark background.

props.synopsis: Keep up with how many medals Aussie athletes won on day nine — and where Australia sits on the leaderboard.

title.children: Here's the medal standings on day nine of the Olympic Games

image.altText: Zach Merrett shares a hug with Archie Roberts

props.synopsis: Essendon captain Zach Merrett was brilliant once again as the Bombers kept within striking distance of the top eight with a one-point win over Fremantle at the MCG.

title.children: 'Earn a bit of respect': Skipper's admission as Dons save season with ridiculous comeback win

image.altText: Nathan Cleary of the Panthers celebrates scoring a try with teammates

props.synopsis: Nathan Cleary has scored a late try to lift Penrith to victory over a brave Knights side, while Stephen Crichton starred in Canterbury's win over Canberra.

title.children: Nathan Cleary produces another match-winning performance, Bulldogs hold on for win over Raiders

image.altText: A graphic of a red up arrow next to a percentage sign, overlaid on a street view of a row of houses.

props.synopsis: Anyone with a home loan right now is likely to be closely watching the Reserve Bank of Australia, which is meeting this week to decide whether it will change the cash rate target. Here's what you need to know.

title.children: Major banks have different forecasts for rate drops — but they agree on the outcome of this week's meeting

image.altText: Police gather in the middle of a road as smoke is rising from objects burning on the ground.

props.synopsis: Dozens of people have been killed and the government is imposing a nationwide curfew after protesters calling for the country's prime minister to resign clashed with police.

title.children: Deadly protests in Bangladesh amid calls for prime minister to resign

image.altText: A close-up composite image of the two women who both have a serious expression.

props.synopsis: Territorians will head to the polls in three weeks for what's likely to be a close contest between the Labor government and the Country Liberal Party opposition. Here are the key players and big issues shaping the election.

title.children: Everything you need to know about the NT election

image.altText: Freddie Crittenden trails behind the rest of the 110m hurdles field at Paris Olympics.

props.synopsis: Freddie Crittenden did not try in his 110m hurdles heat because he knew he could qualify for the newly implemented repechage rounds and rest an injury for two days before giving it his best shot.

title.children: US track star cleverly uses new athletics rule to give himself a second chance at Paris Olympics glory

image.altText: High density housing with predominantly dark roofs.

props.synopsis: Access to decent housing should be the "Great Australian Right," says a former Victorian Supreme Court justice.

title.children: Australia must treat housing as a human right, says former Victorian Supreme Court judge

image.altText: a person carrying a baby in the front seat of a car with both not wearing seatbelts

props.synopsis: The NSW government warns if the current trend keeps up more than 100,000 fines will be issued to drivers caught by seatbelt detection cameras over the next 12 months.

title.children: Unrestrained adult and baby among thousands captured by new seatbelt cameras

image.altText: Bright coloured portraits of three LGBTQIA+ advocates from South-East Asia.

props.synopsis: Thailand's reputation as a "queer paradise" may do more than just line the pockets of wedding vendors.

title.children: No wedding, no kids: Why LGBTQIA+ Asians are moving to this 'queer paradise'

image.altText: A takeaway pasta dish still in its box

props.synopsis: Originally introduced in the country by US chain Outback Steakhouse, experts say the dish's meteoric rise proves there are big export opportunities in South Korea for "truly authentic" Aussie products.

title.children: How a pasta dish named after an Australian inland city took South Korea by storm

image.altText: a middle-aged male police officer in uniform outdoors

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory's police commissioner has delivered an apology to First Nations people and pledged to "eliminate racism" within the force during a speech at Garma Festival.

title.children: 'I am deeply sorry': NT Police commissioner makes apology to Indigenous people at Garma

image.altText: a row of four children in school uniform looking at smartphones

props.synopsis: The ABC asked high school students what they thought about social media bans for people under 14 set to be mooted by state governments. Here's what they had to say.

title.children: Teens say social media literacy key to online safety, not age restrictions

image.altText: Woman holding phone infront of another man

props.synopsis: Two different communities living 15,000 kilometres apart have found a way to heal together after experiencing severe natural disasters.

title.children: From Brazil to the WA outback, how two remote communities found strength after natural disasters

image.altText: A street sign that reads 'Wall St' in foreground of USA flag

props.synopsis: There are genuine concerns the world's largest economy is heading toward a recession, and the fear is gripping global financial markets.

title.children: 'We are being tossed around on a sea of volatility': Fears US economy headed towards recession

image.altText: A photo taken from over the top of the King and Queen showing off their crowns

props.synopsis: Days after he lost his job, the former assistant minister for a republic called the movement to offer reassurance.

title.children: The PM has torpedoed the republic portfolio, but the movement says it understands why

image.altText: 3d rendering of abstract geometric shapes and cube blocks. Neon lights, blue and pink colors.

props.synopsis: Scientists are harnessing the Tetris effect, a phenomenon described by people who play the classic 1980s video puzzle game, to help unlock dreams and treat post traumatic stress disorder.

title.children: Love playing Tetris? Its effects on your brain are surprisingly profound

image.altText: Tom Gleeson standing with his arms crossed and a serious look on his face. The Hard Quiz has been added behind his head

props.synopsis: So you're back to give this quiz thing another go? Come on then, I promise I won't judge … much.

title.children: Still believe you can beat me at my own game? It's time to play … HARD!

image.altText: Wilderness expert Michael Atkinson with snow behind her

props.synopsis: Loyal skiers and snowboarders say the cost of visiting Australia's snowfields is getting to expensive for average-income workers. Here are some reasons why.

title.children: How the price of an Australian snow trip compares to the rest of the world
